libraries

Class Algorithm2

  • java.lang.Object
    • libraries.Algorithm2

  • public class Algorithm2
extends java.lang.Object
    This class includes all the static function which calculate all the data by the algorithm 2 formulas. Here all the function are static. The explanation we could give (as students) is the next one : Here all the methods are used to be a mathematical reflexion. There is no object into those functions. For example f(x) = 2x + 4 changes the x into 2x + 4, here the methods do the same. That's why we choose the do a large class which play the role of library for all the formulas of the algorithm 2. The SampleScan input and data need to be of the same size, and the noSignal need to be initialize.
    Author:
    Orel and Samuel.

      • inputPi

        public static void inputPi(SampleScan input,
                           WeigthAverage data)
        This method set the pi number into the object WeigthAverage. What is the pi number ? The pi number is a number define by the that follow into the getWeigth function and getDiff function. This number replace the weight of the algorithm 1. Recall that weigh = 1 / (signal * signal)
        Parameters:
        input -
        data -

        public static void setLocation(SampleScan input,
